mods.abstract: The result of controlled burning of the marsh on muskrat lands. With water on the ground and a fresh wind blowing the fire swept over the muskrat houses without setting them afire. As a result of the burning off the rough dead grasses new growths of three-cornered rush appeared. A fire set during the dry spell would cause a great deal of damage, it has been demonstrated.

titleInfo.title: Louisiana Sea Grant Digital Images Collection
